name: Cable Mountain Lodge

reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights in this very good lodge.
reviews.title: a home away from home
Would Definitely Stay Here Again
reviews.text: The location is excellent, minutes from the entrance to the park and next door to shops, a cinema and a big convenience shop that sells everything from fresh food to hiking equipment.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The “room” is really a fully equipped and very comfortable home with everything you might need.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.text: Wi-fi is free and there is a very good swimming pool open until late in the evening.
reviews.title: comfortable and convenient

reviews.text: Breakfast can be taken at a very good cafe , just minutes from the Lodge.
reviews.title: Helpful staff, Great location and rooms

reviews.text: We were in a one-bedroom suite with kitchen. Was great to be able to make our own dinner and breakfast and then pack lunches to eat in the park. Park proximity was amazing, just steps away from a shuttle bus. It really felt like we were at a high-end condo or timeshare- granite countertop, really nice furniture and bathroom fixtures. Pool and hot tub were nice, and big pool towels were provided. View from pool was gorgeous. Our ground floor unit had a small side patio with two chairs which was pleasant. Overall an expensive, but worth it place to stay as a base for Zion National Park.
reviews.title: Worth the price

reviews.text: We were happy with our stay at the lodge, particularly since they let us check out a day early as it was raining and with two small children we were not going to have a great day in Zion! The lodge was spacious, clean and very comfortable. We couldn't get one of the televisions to work, but I didn't care so I didn't ask for any assistance. I am sure that they would have happily assisted us as the staff are very friendly.
reviews.title: Spacious cabins and great location

reviews.text: The location of the lodge is excellent. You are literally steps away from the park and there are a few places to eat and shops to browse on your door step. The giant screen theatre is next door. We took our kids to see the complimentary movie on the canyons. We were told by the guys at the theatre that it wasn't scary. It is a little! So if you have small kids be warned! Our kids were fine, but there is a death scene and a fighting scene. It is fairly short though.
reviews.title: Nice view, nice location, very friendly staff
Super convenient proximity to Zion NP
reviews.text: There are some lovely restaurants in town, including the Spotted Dog and a pizza and pasta place that we highly recommend.

My only gripe was with the daily service. Could have been better. One day the bed was half made (pillows were left strewn around the bedroom) which I thought was a bit weird. Besides that, I would absolutely recommend this property. I don't think you would be disappointed sitting on your balcony soaking in the view with a gorgeous kind size bed ready for you to hop into after a day of hiking and sun!
reviews.title: Perfect location across river from Zion -- watch out for the bidet!
Perfect location for Zion NP
reviews.text: Located next to the entrance of Zion National Park, this is perfectly placed for any visit - more flexible than the official lodge but just as convenient. Excellent quality room with giant bed. Good on-site facilities, which although not part of the lodge itself are five steps away.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visted Zion in late September and stayed at the Cable Mountain Lodge for 3 nights. Simply stated, this is a great place to stay. Two minute walk to the park entrance. Parked my car in the lot, walked into the park, and took the very convenient shuttles everywhere we wanted to go. Very nice rooms. Very clean, tastefully decorated, nice kitchen with full size appliances, big bathroom, nice little patios and balconies, beds very comfortable and cozy, flat panel tv in living room and bedroom. The pool and jacuzzi very nice, especially after the long wonderful hikes. Pool water was warm even at night. The views are breathtaking. Several nice places to grab a bite to eat within walking distance. Other small local restaurants just a short drive into town. A decent small grocery store right next to the lodge. Staff very pleasant and helpful. Love this place! Definitely will be back.
reviews.title: Perfect!
Convenient location, clean modern rooms
reviews.text: The best thing about the Cable Mountain Lodge is probably its location -- right next to the park entrance and shuttle. There's also a market, bakery, movie theatre, and other shops in the same complex.

The rooms are nice too. We stayed in one of the courtyard suite rooms and it was basically a nice small apartment tastefully furnished in a modern Southwestern style (complete with kitchen and living room). There was some noise from the upstairs room, and the patios are much nicer up there as well, so try to stay upstairs if you can.
reviews.title: Luxury at Zion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For ambience, we like the Desert Pearl Inn better but would happily stay at Cable Mountain again (and it seems to sell out less often because it is larger). We also recommend eating at the Whiptail Grill down the street -- the food is excellent, the casual appearance notwithstanding.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay for Zion NP

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a park view one-bedroom suite with a king bed. Kitchen is a great convenience. We had breakfast in the room each day and made our own lunches and snacks to take for our daily outings to Zion park. There was a stove, microwave, fridge, sink, garbage disposal, dishwasher, coffeepot, dishes, pots and pans, utensils and they provide coffee and tea daily. Large tv's in living room and bedroom. Comfortable sofa and chair in the living room and small dining table for 4. There is a washer and dryer available next to the office for $1.50 each. Took our own detergent sheet but you can buy it from the office if needed. Check-in was very quick and simple. There are no elevators, if you are on the second floor you will carry your luggage up the stairs. We wanted to be on the top floor for more quiet. Guests were quiet and not disruptive at all. The view from the room is fantastic, there are chairs on the balcony where we sat to watch sunset and moonrise. Mattress was very comfortable, the entire suite was spotless. Very short walk to the park entrance and visitor center. You can ride the town shuttle to most restaurants. We walked to dinner a couple times as there are sidewalks on the main road. It was near-perfect and worth the cost all the way. Quibbles - lack of drapes in the bedroom allowed more light in than we are used to sleeping with and the maid missed us one day, but she brought me coffee for the next morning and we don't care to have fresh sheets and towels daily, so it was OK.
reviews.title: Great Stay, Great View

reviews.text: There were 5 of us family members in a 1 bedroom suite with a fold out bed and a sofa bed. Certainly crowded, and not conducive for privacy and intimacy since we all shared one bathroom. Liked the refrigerator, kitchen arrangement since there is a nice foodstore right next door. We made all of our sandwiches and snacks for our daily hikes in Zion, We were at the hotel in August which is not a time of year I would recommend to visit the park- way too hot (of course we had no choice on dates because all our kids are in school).
reviews.title: Awesome location, Good rooms, and the pool is great

reviews.text: The pool was a blessing, because each day after we returned from our hikes (in the early afternoon) the temperature was over 100 degrees. We spent hours in the pool or beside the pool.
reviews.title: Perfect place to stay and see Zion

reviews.text: One other real plus besides the easy access to the entrance to Zion (you can leave your car parked in the hotel lot and walk into the park) is at night - we could walk over to the Ranger talks across the Virgin River in the campground.
reviews.title: Would go back again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This lodge has more of a feel of a condo than a hotel. Super clean with a great kitchen ( full fridge, 2 burners, microwave and dishwasher). The king was very comfy but the pull out sofa is your typical sofa bed. We found out at check out you can request a foam topper for it ( But request it before you get there because they run out on full weekends. The pool is very well maintained and has an amazing view of Zion mountains while you sit in the Jacuzzi or watch kids swimming while you lounge poolside. Also the lodge is on the same property as a grocery store, imax movie theater ( you get free tickets with your booking too!) gift store, bakery, equipment rental and restaurant. All very handy. Also on the river they provide a couple of nice BBQs to cook up and picnic benches to enjoy riverside with the most breathtaking views all directions. The lodge is the closest to the entrance to the park. You walk across the bridge right to the entrance of the park, remember to tell them this is your whole CAR group if you are more than 2 otherwise you have to pay per person and at $12 per person that adds up.
reviews.title: Great location and comfortable!

description: Number of rooms: 50. There is literally nothing between you and the park, simply cross the footbridge from the property and you are at the entrance of Zion National Park. It truly is a custom masterpiece inside and out. We offer up-scale amenities including a relaxing pool and jacuzzi, immaculate room decor, remarkable views and access to the giant screen theatre. All rooms are non-smoking and include a kitchenette and suites include a fully-equipped kitchen with a market located on the same property.
